Introduction to Information Technology.name: General Copy Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Copies selected text, images, or data to the clipboard for pasting elsewhere.

example.problem: \text{Highlight a paragraph in a text editor and use the copy shortcut to duplicate it.}
example.solution: \text{Press } \text{Ctrl + C} \text{ to copy the highlighted paragraph to the clipboard, then paste it using } \text{Ctrl + V}.

Introduction to Information Technology.name: General Paste Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Pastes the contents of the clipboard at the cursor's location.

example.problem: \text{Paste a copied image into an email body.}
example.solution: \text{After copying the image with } \texttt{Ctrl + C}, \text{ place the cursor in the email body and press } \texttt{Ctrl + V} \text{ to paste the image.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: General Undo Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Reverses the last action performed in most applications.

example.problem: \text{Accidentally delete a sentence in a document and want to restore it.}
example.solution: \text{Press } \texttt{Ctrl + Z} \text{ to undo the deletion and restore the sentence.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: Excel SUM Function
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Calculates the sum of values in a specified range of cells in Excel.

example.problem: \text{Calculate the total sales for cells } A1 \text{ to } A5 \text{ containing values } 100, 200, 150, 300, \text{ and } 250 \text{ in Excel.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: Excel AutoFill Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Fills the selected cell(s) with the content of the cell above it in Excel.

example.problem: \text{Copy a formula in cell } B1 \text{ to cells } B2 \text{ to } B5 \text{ in Excel.}
example.solution: \text{Select cells } B1 \text{ to } B5, \text{ then press } \texttt{Ctrl + D} \text{ to fill the formula from } B1 \text{ into } B2:B5.

Introduction to Information Technology.name: Excel Insert Row Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Inserts a new row above the selected row in Excel.

example.problem: \text{Insert a new row above row } 3 \text{ in an Excel spreadsheet.}
example.solution: \text{Select row } 3 \text{ by clicking its number, then press } \texttt{Ctrl + Shift + +} \text{ to insert a new row above it.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: Word Bold Text Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Applies bold formatting to selected text in Microsoft Word.

example.problem: \text{Make the title 'Annual Report' bold in a Word document.}
example.solution: \text{Highlight 'Annual Report' and press } \texttt{Ctrl + B} \text{ to apply bold formatting.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: Word Find Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Opens the Find dialog box to search for text in a Word document.

example.problem: \text{Search for the word 'technology' in a Word document.}
example.solution: \text{Press } \texttt{Ctrl + F}, \text{ type 'technology' in the search box, and press Enter to find its occurrences.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: Word Insert Hyperlink Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Opens the Insert Hyperlink dialog box to add a hyperlink to selected text in Word.

example.problem: \text{Add a hyperlink to the text 'Visit Website' linking to } \texttt{https://example.com} \text{ in a Word document.}
example.solution: \text{Highlight 'Visit Website', press } \texttt{Ctrl + K}, \text{ enter } \texttt{https://example.com} \text{ in the dialog box, and click OK.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: PowerPoint New Slide Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Inserts a new slide in a PowerPoint presentation.

example.problem: \text{Add a new slide to a PowerPoint presentation after the current slide.}
example.solution: \text{Press } \texttt{Ctrl + M} \text{ to insert a new slide with the default layout.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: PowerPoint Start Slideshow Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Starts the slideshow from the first slide in PowerPoint.

example.problem: \text{Start a PowerPoint presentation from the beginning.}
example.solution: \text{Press } \texttt{F5} \text{ to begin the slideshow from the first slide.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: PowerPoint Duplicate Slide Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Duplicates the selected slide in PowerPoint.

example.problem: \text{Duplicate the currently selected slide in a PowerPoint presentation.}
example.solution: \text{Select the slide in the slide pane and press } \texttt{Ctrl + D} \text{ to create a duplicate.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: Excel VLOOKUP Function
Introduction to Information Technology.formula: =VLOOKUP(lookup\ value, table\ array, col\ index\ num, [range\ lookup])

variables.table array: The range of cells containing the data
variables.col index num: The column number in the range containing the return value
variables.range lookup: TRUE for approximate match, FALSE for exact match

Introduction to Information Technology.description: Searches for a value in the first column of a range and returns a value in the same row from another column in Excel.

example.problem: \text{In an Excel table with product IDs in column } A \text{ and prices in column } B, \text{ find the price of product ID 'P003' where } A2:A5 \text{ contains } \{'P001', 'P002', 'P003', 'P004'\} \text{ and } B2:B5 \text{ contains } \{10, 20, 30, 40\}.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: Word Page Break Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Inserts a manual page break in a Word document.

example.problem: \text{Insert a page break after a section in a Word document.}
example.solution: \text{Place the cursor at the end of the section and press } \texttt{Ctrl + Enter} \text{ to start a new page.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: PowerPoint Align Objects Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Opens the alignment options for selected objects in PowerPoint.

example.problem: \text{Align two text boxes to the left in a PowerPoint slide.}
example.solution: \text{Select both text boxes, press } \texttt{Alt + H, G, A}, \text{ then select 'Align Left' from the menu.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: General Cut Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Cuts (removes) the selected text, image, or data and places it on the clipboard.

example.problem: \text{Move a sentence from one paragraph to another in a Word document.}
example.solution: \text{Highlight the sentence, press } \texttt{Ctrl + X}, \text{ place the cursor elsewhere, then press } \texttt{Ctrl + V}.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: General Save Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Saves the current document, spreadsheet, or presentation.

example.problem: \text{Save changes made to a Word document.}
example.solution: \text{Press } \texttt{Ctrl + S} \text{ to save the file immediately.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: General Select All Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Selects all content in the active document or window.

example.problem: \text{Highlight all text in a document to change its font.}
example.solution: \text{Press } \texttt{Ctrl + A} \text{ to select all content.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: Excel AVERAGE Function
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Calculates the average (arithmetic mean) of numbers in a range.

example.problem: \text{Find the average of scores } 80, 90, 70, 100, 60 \text{ in cells A1:A5.}
example.solution: \text{Enter } =\texttt{AVERAGE(A1:A5)} \text{ which equals } \boxed{80}.

Introduction to Information Technology.name: Excel IF Function
Introduction to Information Technology.formula: =IF(condition, value\ if\ true, value\ if\ false)
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Performs a logical test and returns one value if TRUE, another if FALSE.

example.problem: \text{Check if the score in cell B2 is a passing grade (>=50).}
example.solution: \text{Enter } =\texttt{IF(B2>=50, "Pass", "Fail")}.

Introduction to Information Technology.name: Excel CONCAT Function
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Joins multiple text strings into a single string.

example.problem: \text{Combine first name in cell A2 with last name in cell B2.}
example.solution: \text{Enter } =\texttt{CONCAT(A2, " ", B2)}.

Introduction to Information Technology.name: Word Italic Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Applies italic formatting to selected text in Word.

example.problem: \text{Italicize the word 'technology' in a Word document.}
example.solution: \text{Highlight 'technology' and press } \texttt{Ctrl + I}.

Introduction to Information Technology.name: Word Underline Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Applies underline formatting to selected text in Word.

example.problem: \text{Underline the title 'Summary Report'.}
example.solution: \text{Highlight 'Summary Report' and press } \texttt{Ctrl + U}.

Introduction to Information Technology.name: Word Save As Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Opens the Save As dialog box to save the document under a new name or format.

example.problem: \text{Save a Word file as a PDF copy.}
example.solution: \text{Press } \texttt{F12}, \text{ choose PDF format, and click Save.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: PowerPoint End Slideshow Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Ends the PowerPoint slideshow presentation.

example.problem: \text{Exit a running slideshow at any time.}
example.solution: \text{Press } \texttt{Esc} \text{ to return to editing mode.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: PowerPoint Start Slideshow from Current Slide
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Starts the slideshow from the currently selected slide.

example.problem: \text{Present a slideshow starting from slide 5 instead of the beginning.}
example.solution: \text{Select slide 5 and press } \texttt{Shift + F5}.

Introduction to Information Technology.name: PowerPoint Group Objects Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Groups multiple selected objects in PowerPoint.

example.problem: \text{Group two images together so they move as one.}
example.solution: \text{Select both images and press } \texttt{Ctrl + G}.

Introduction to Information Technology.name: Excel INDEX Function

variables.array: Range of cells or array constant

Introduction to Information Technology.description: Returns the value of a cell in a table based on row and column numbers.

example.problem: \text{Find the value in the 2nd row and 3rd column of the range A1:C3 where A1:C3 contains numbers 1–9.}
example.solution: \text{Enter } =\texttt{INDEX(A1:C3, 2, 3)} \text{ which returns } \boxed{6}.

Introduction to Information Technology.name: Excel MATCH Function

variables.match type: 1 = less than, 0 = exact match, -1 = greater than

Introduction to Information Technology.description: Returns the relative position of a value in a range.

example.problem: \text{Find the position of 'P003' in the list A1:A5 containing P001, P002, P003, P004, P005.}
example.solution: \text{Enter } =\texttt{MATCH("P003", A1:A5, 0)} \text{ which returns } \boxed{3}.

Introduction to Information Technology.name: Excel LEN Function

variables.text: The text string or cell reference

Introduction to Information Technology.description: Returns the number of characters in a text string, including spaces.

example.problem: \text{Count the number of characters in the word 'Technology'.}
example.solution: \text{Enter } =\texttt{LEN("Technology")} \text{ which equals } \boxed{10}.

Introduction to Information Technology.name: Excel TRIM Function
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Removes all extra spaces from a text string, leaving only single spaces between words.

example.problem: \text{Clean up text in A1 that contains '  Data   Science  '.}
example.solution: \text{Enter } =\texttt{TRIM(A1)} \text{ which results in 'Data Science'.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: Excel PMT Function
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Calculates the payment for a loan based on constant interest rate and number of periods.

example.problem: \text{Calculate monthly payment for a $10,000 loan at 5% annual interest over 5 years.}
example.solution: \text{Enter } =\texttt{PMT(5\%/12, 60, -10000)} \text{ which gives } \approx \boxed{-188.71}.

Introduction to Information Technology.name: Word Track Changes Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Turns Track Changes on or off to monitor edits in a Word document.

example.problem: \text{Enable Track Changes while editing a contract.}
example.solution: \text{Press } \texttt{Ctrl + Shift + E} \text{ to toggle Track Changes.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: Word Show/Hide Formatting Marks Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Displays or hides non-printing characters such as spaces, paragraph marks, and tabs.

example.problem: \text{Reveal hidden paragraph breaks in a Word document.}
example.solution: \text{Press } \texttt{Ctrl + Shift + 8} \text{ to show formatting marks.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: Word Format Painter Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.formula: Ctrl + Shift + C / Ctrl + Shift + V
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Copies formatting from selected text and applies it to other text.

example.problem: \text{Copy bold + italic formatting from one heading and apply it to another.}
example.solution: \text{Highlight the formatted text, press } \texttt{Ctrl + Shift + C}, \text{ then highlight the target text and press } \texttt{Ctrl + Shift + V}.

Introduction to Information Technology.name: PowerPoint Reuse Slides Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Opens the Reuse Slides pane to insert slides from another presentation.

example.problem: \text{Insert slides from another PowerPoint file into the current presentation.}
example.solution: \text{Press } \texttt{Alt + H, I, S} \text{ and select the file to import slides.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: PowerPoint Ungroup Objects Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Ungroups grouped objects so they can be edited individually.

example.problem: \text{Break apart a grouped chart and text box.}
example.solution: \text{Select the group and press } \texttt{Ctrl + Shift + G}.

Introduction to Information Technology.name: PowerPoint Insert Screenshot Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Inserts a screenshot or screen clipping into a slide.

example.problem: \text{Capture part of the desktop and insert it into a presentation.}
example.solution: \text{Press } \texttt{Alt + N, S, C}, \text{ then select the area to capture.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: General Task Manager Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Opens Task Manager directly in Windows to monitor applications and processes.

example.problem: \text{Quickly check CPU usage of a running program.}
example.solution: \text{Press } \texttt{Ctrl + Shift + Esc} \text{ to open Task Manager.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: General Switch Applications Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Switches between open applications in Windows.

example.problem: \text{Move from a Word document to a browser without using the mouse.}
example.solution: \text{Hold } \texttt{Alt} \text{ and press } \texttt{Tab} \text{ to cycle through apps.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: General Lock Computer Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Locks the computer and returns to the sign-in screen.

example.problem: \text{Secure your PC before stepping away.}
example.solution: \text{Press } \texttt{Windows + L} \text{ to lock the computer.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: General Screenshot Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Opens Snip & Sketch tool to capture part of the screen.

example.problem: \text{Capture only a section of your desktop screen.}
example.solution: \text{Press } \texttt{Windows + Shift + S}, \text{ drag over the area to capture, and it is copied to clipboard.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: General File Explorer Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Opens File Explorer to browse files and folders.

example.problem: \text{Quickly open the Documents folder.}
example.solution: \text{Press } \texttt{Windows + E} \text{ to open File Explorer.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: General Run Dialog Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Opens the Run dialog box to execute commands or open programs quickly.

example.problem: \text{Open Notepad without searching manually.}
example.solution: \text{Press } \texttt{Windows + R}, \text{ type 'notepad', and press Enter.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: General Minimize All Windows Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Shows the desktop by minimizing all open windows.

example.problem: \text{Quickly access a file saved on the desktop while many windows are open.}
example.solution: \text{Press } \texttt{Windows + D} \text{ to minimize all and show the desktop.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: General Virtual Desktop Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Creates a new virtual desktop in Windows.

example.problem: \text{Set up a separate workspace for studying while keeping your main desktop clean.}
example.solution: \text{Press } \texttt{Windows + Ctrl + D} \text{ to add a new virtual desktop.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: General Close Current Window Shortcut
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Closes the current application window.

example.problem: \text{Exit a browser window without using the mouse.}
example.solution: \text{Press } \texttt{Alt + F4}.

Introduction to Information Technology.name: Excel XLOOKUP Function
Introduction to Information Technology.formula: =XLOOKUP(lookup\ value, lookup\ array, return\ array, [if\ not\ found], [match\ mode], [search\ mode])

variables.\\text{match mode}: 0=Exact, -1=Exact or next smaller, 1=Exact or next larger (optional)

Introduction to Information Technology.description: Performs a powerful lookup to find values across a range, replacing VLOOKUP and HLOOKUP.

example.problem: \text{Find the price of product ID 'P003' where IDs are in A2:A5 and prices in B2:B5.}
example.solution: \text{Enter } =\texttt{XLOOKUP("P003", A2:A5, B2:B5)} \text{ which returns } \boxed{30}.

Introduction to Information Technology.name: Excel INDEX + MATCH Combination

variables.\\text{return range}: The range to return values from

Introduction to Information Technology.description: Combines INDEX and MATCH for flexible lookups, often used as a VLOOKUP alternative.

example.problem: \text{Get the price of 'P003' where A2:A5 contains IDs and B2:B5 contains prices.}
example.solution: \text{Enter } =\texttt{INDEX(B2:B5, MATCH("P003", A2:A5, 0))} \text{ which returns } \boxed{30}.

Introduction to Information Technology.name: Excel PROPER Function
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Capitalizes the first letter of each word in a text string.

example.problem: \text{Format the text 'introduction to information technology' properly.}
example.solution: \text{Enter } =\texttt{PROPER("introduction to information technology")} \text{ which results in 'Introduction To Information Technology'.}

Introduction to Information Technology.name: Excel TODAY Function
Introduction to Information Technology.description: Returns the current date.

example.problem: \text{Display today's date in a report header.}
example.solution: \text{Enter } =\texttt{TODAY()}.
